marketNews.title: US Economy Weakens, Trade War Sentiment Eases
marketNews.content:
US economy contracted by 0.3% annualized in 1Q25 (vs. 4Q24: +2.4% annualized), according to the advance estimate from the US Bureau of Economic Analysis. This result is far below the consensus expectation of +0.3% annualized and marks the first contraction since 1Q22.

On a year-over-year basis, the US economy still grew +2% YoY in 1Q25 (vs. 4Q24: +2.5% YoY), but this is the first slowdown since 4Q22. The weakness was driven by a surge in imports of +41.3% QoQ and +13.4% YoY, as companies stocked up in anticipation of higher tariffs.

On the other hand, trade-war sentiment between the US and China has begun to ease. On Friday (2 May), the Chinese government said it was evaluating the possibility of tariff negotiations with the US. However, the Chinese Ministry of Commerce stressed that it would only negotiate if the US first cancelled tariffs on Chinese goods.

Following the positive sentiment from the potential de-escalation of the trade war, gold prices fell to $3,260 per troy ounce on Friday (2 May), after reaching an all-time high of $3,423 per troy ounce on 21 April 2025. The US Dollar Index (DXY) also improved by +0.35% week-over-week to 99.82 on Friday (2 May), after briefly dropping to a March-2022 low of 98.27 on 21 April 2025.

In Indonesia, the rupiah strengthened by +2.35% week-over-week to 16,435 per US dollar on Friday (2 May), improving from its all-time low of 16,870 on 24 April 2025. On the same day, the IDX Composite (IHSG) rose by +0.72% and the 10-year Indonesian government bond yield fell by about 5 basis points to 6.88%.

Key Takeaway: Prospects of US-China trade negotiations could make the US economic slowdown smoother than previously feared, providing a risk-on sentiment for markets, especially emerging markets. However, the flow of capital from the US market will still depend on each country’s growth outlook. Domestically, a more stable rupiah could give Bank Indonesia room to cut the BI Rate to support economic growth.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need To Know
marketNews.content:
1. Reuters surveyed economists expect Indonesia's economy to slow to +4.91% YoY in 1Q25 (vs. 4Q24 actual +5.02% YoY). Quarterly, economists forecast a contraction of -0.89% QoQ in 1Q25 (vs. 4Q24 actual +0.53% QoQ). The outlook reflects higher global trade uncertainty and lower government spending in 1Q25. Indonesia's Q1 2025 GDP data will be released on 5 May 2025.

2. BPS reported that Indonesia's Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation rose to 1.95% YoY in April 2025 (vs. March 2025: 1.03% YoY), the highest since August 2024, driven by Lebaran effects. Monthly, CPI inflation eased to 1.17% MoM (vs. March 2025: 1.65% MoM). Core inflation increased to 2.5% YoY (vs. March 2025: 2.48% YoY), the highest in 22 months.

3. S&P Global noted that Indonesia's Manufacturing PMI fell to 46.7 in April 2025 (vs. March 2024: 52.4), marking the first contraction in six months and the steepest decline since August 2021.

4. The Ministry of Finance recorded that the 2025 state budget deficit reached 104.2 trillion rupiah or 0.43% of GDP as of 1Q25. Nevertheless, the primary balance remained in surplus at 17.5 trillion rupiah. The 2025 budget targets a deficit of 2.53% of GDP and a primary deficit of 63.3 trillion rupiah.

5. S&P Global reported that China's Manufacturing PMI dropped to 50.4 in April 2025 (vs. March 2025: 51.2) but stayed above the consensus of 49.8. This indicates an expansion for the seventh consecutive month, albeit the weakest growth since January 2025, reflecting continued stimulus support.

6. The US Bureau of Labor Statistics showed that US job openings fell by 288,000 to 7.19 million in March 2025 (vs. February 2025: 7.48 million), below the consensus of 7.48 million and marking the lowest level in six months.

7. Barito Renewables Energy ($BREN) reported a net profit of 34 million USD in 1Q25 (+19% YoY, -5% QoQ). The YoY profit increase was mainly due to a reduction in net financial expenses to 26 million USD (-8% YoY, -8% QoQ) after refinancing in September 2024, and a favorable currency exchange gain of 1 million USD (1Q24: loss of 1 million USD, 4Q24: gain of 2 million USD). Stockbit calculated EBITDA of 126 million USD in 1Q25 (+3% YoY, -5% QoQ).

8. Prabowo Subianto's adviser, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, told Reuters that the government plans to build 10 GW of nuclear power plants, part of a target to add 103 GW of capacity by 2040. The additional capacity will consist of 75 GW from solar, wind, geothermal and biomass, and 18 GW from gas. Indonesia currently has 90 GW of installed capacity, with only 15 GW from renewable sources.

9. BPS reported that foreign tourist arrivals to Indonesia reached approximately 841,000 in March 2025 (-2.2% YoY, -5.6% MoM). This brought total Q1 2025 foreign arrivals to about 2.7 million (+7.8% YoY), representing 17-20% of the 2025 government target of 14-16 million.

tickerNews.title: DATA acquisition of 40% by TOWR
tickerNews.content: $DATA: Remala Abadi announced that its subsidiary Sarana Menara Nusantara ($TOWR), PT iForte Solusi Infotek, has acquired 40% of DATA's shares at a price of 974 rupiah per share, totaling 535.7 billion rupiah. The acquisition price is 30% lower than DATA's share price on Friday (2 May) of 1,385 rupiah. The shares were bought from DATA's previous controllers, Verah Wahyudi Singgih Wong and Jimmi Anka. After the transaction, TOWR through iForte becomes the controller of DATA and will carry out a mandatory tender offer.

tickerNews.title: SIDO reports Q1 2025 net profit
tickerNews.content: $SIDO: Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul reported a net profit of 233 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-40% YoY, -41% QoQ), below expectations (20%/18% consensus). The profit decline was mainly due to weaker revenue, which also negatively impacted margins. Revenue fell to 789 billion rupiah (-25% YoY, -39% QoQ), and the core operating margin dropped to 35% (vs. 1Q24: 46.7%, 4Q24: 39.1%).

tickerNews.title: ACES reports Q1 2025 net profit
tickerNews.content: $ACES: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia posted a net profit of 142 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-31% YoY, -55% QoQ), below expectations at 15% of the 2025 consensus estimate (vs. ~22% over the past three years). Revenue grew YoY to 2.1 trillion rupiah (+7% YoY, -9% QoQ), in line with the consensus (23% estimate) and above the guidance targeting +5% YoY revenue growth. The weak profit was driven by a rise in opex-to-sales to 42.3% (+572 bps YoY, +833 bps QoQ) due to rebranding efforts. This pushed the operating margin down to 9% (vs. 1Q24: 13.3%, 4Q24: 17.8%), resulting in operating profit of 192 billion rupiah (-28% YoY, -54% QoQ), also below expectations at 17% of the 2025 consensus.

tickerNews.title: PWON reports Q1 2025 net profit
tickerNews.content: $PWON: Pakuwon Jati posted a net profit of 302 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-9% YoY, -27% QoQ), matching 12% of the 2025 consensus estimate. Revenue rose slightly YoY to 1.6 trillion rupiah (+2% YoY, -18% QoQ), supported by a 10% YoY increase in recurring income (-5% QoQ). Net profit was pressured by: 1) a decline in operating margin to 41.5% (vs. 1Q24: 43.4%, 4Q24: 42.1%) due to a 12% YoY increase in opex (-18% QoQ); and 2) higher other expenses, reaching 94 billion rupiah (vs. 1Q24: 19 billion rupiah, 4Q24: 44 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: SMRA reports Q1 2025 net profit
tickerNews.content: $SMRA: Summarecon Agung posted a net profit of 238 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-46% YoY, -46% QoQ), equal to 21% of the 2025 consensus estimate. The profit decline was driven by higher opex amid flat revenue and high minority interest. Revenue was 2.1 trillion rupiah (-1% YoY, -32% QoQ) due to a drop in revenue recognition in the 'property development' segment (-8% YoY, -41% QoQ). Operating margin fell to 29.9% (vs. 1Q24: 33.7%, 4Q24: 30.8%) because opex rose to 436 billion rupiah (+14% YoY, -17% QoQ). Minority interest increased YoY to 78 billion rupiah (vs. 1Q24: 4 billion rupiah, 4Q24: 149 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: JPFA reports Q1 2025 net profit
tickerNews.content: $JPFA: Japfa Comfeed Indonesia posted a net profit of 680 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-26% QoQ, +2% YoY), slightly below expectations (23%/20% consensus). The quarterly profit decline was mainly due to a drop in operating profit to 1.1 trillion rupiah (-22% QoQ, 0% YoY), equal to 23%/21% of the 2025 consensus. Operating profit fell in the 'poultry breeding/DOC' (-23% QoQ), 'commercial farm/broiler' (-72% QoQ), and 'poultry processing and consumer products' (-20% QoQ) segments, driven by lower average prices for DOC (5,518 rupiah per bird, -10% QoQ) and broiler (19,220 rupiah per kg, -5% QoQ). Conversely, the 'feed' segment saw operating profit surge to 632 billion rupiah (+110% QoQ) as average corn price rose modestly to 4,852 rupiah per kg (+2% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: MAPI reports Q1 2025 net profit
tickerNews.content: $MAPI: Mitra Adiperkasa posted a net profit of 472 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (+14% YoY, +1% QoQ), in line with expectations at 21% of the 2025 consensus estimate. Revenue grew YoY by 6% (down 9% QoQ) to meet the 22% consensus estimate. Operating profit also grew YoY to 769 billion rupiah (+8% YoY, -28% QoQ), matching 19% of the consensus. The operating profit increase was driven by MAP Aktif Adiperkasa ($MAPA) which grew +16% YoY. The 'fashion & digital' segment grew +14% YoY, while the 'department stores' segment grew +40% YoY. The 'café & restaurant' segment deteriorated, posting a loss of 62 billion rupiah (vs. 1Q24: loss of 26 billion rupiah).

tickerNews.title: HEAL reports Q1 2025 net profit
tickerNews.content: $HEAL: Medikaloka Hermina posted a net profit of 125 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-35% YoY, +84% QoQ), matching 20% of the 2025 consensus estimate. The profit decline was due to lower operating margin and higher financial expenses. Operating margin fell YoY to 15.6% (vs. 1Q24: 19.5%, 4Q24: 11.4%) while revenue remained flat at 1.7 trillion rupiah (-1% YoY, 0% QoQ). Financial expenses rose to 49 billion rupiah (+75% YoY, 0% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: ERAL reports Q1 2025 net profit
tickerNews.content: $ERAL: Sinar Eka Selaras posted a net profit of 42 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (+3% YoY, -5% QoQ), with revenue growing YoY to 1.4 trillion rupiah (+26% YoY, -3% QoQ). The profit weakness was caused by a surge in opex and a loss on a joint venture. Opex rose to 172 billion rupiah (+74% YoY, +16% QoQ), pushing opex-to-sales to 12.5% (vs. 1Q24: 9.1%, 4Q25: 10.5%). The JV loss amounted to 3 billion rupiah (vs. 1Q24: profit of 4 billion rupiah, 4Q24: profit of 2 billion rupiah) following the full consolidation of JD Sports acquired in November 2024. On the positive side, gross profit margin increased to 16.4% (+387 bps YoY, +293 bps QoQ), driven by a higher mix from the 'fashion apparel' segment, whose gross margin of 22.7% now represents 23% of total revenue (vs. 1Q24: 3%, 4Q24: 12%). Operating margin remained stable YoY at 4.2% (+9 bps YoY, +44 bps QoQ). Operating profit grew to 58 billion rupiah (+28% YoY, +9% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: BRIS reports Q1 2025 net profit
tickerNews.content: $BRIS: Bank Syariah Indonesia posted a net profit of 1.9 trillion rupiah in 1Q25 (+10% YoY, -1% QoQ), roughly in line with the 23% consensus estimate. The profit increase was supported by growth in fee-based income to 1.7 trillion rupiah (+39% YoY, +1.6% QoQ). Net Margin Income (NMI) grew +6.7% YoY, driven by financing growth of +16.2% YoY (vs. 4Q24: +15.9% YoY, 1Q24: +15.9% YoY), aligning with the 2025 guidance of +14-16% YoY. Margin pressure is visible as NMI growth lagged financing growth, reflected in Net Interest (NI) ratio falling to 5.31% (vs. 1Q24: 5.38%, 2024: 5.66%), below the 2025 guidance target of 5.5-5.9%. Asset quality metrics showed credit cost (CoC) slightly rising to 0.93% (vs. 1Q24: 0.88%, 2024: 0.83%), still within the 2025 guidance of below 1%.

tickerNews.title: MAIN reports Q1 2025 net profit
tickerNews.content: $MAIN: Malindo Feedmill posted a net profit of 63 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (-51% QoQ, -28% YoY), with operating profit falling to 159 billion rupiah (-7% QoQ, -32% YoY). The quarterly profit decline was mainly due to a loss in the 'DOC' segment of 41 billion rupiah (vs. 4Q24: profit of 54 billion rupiah), as average DOC price dropped to 5,518 rupiah per bird (-10% QoQ). Operating profit also fell in the 'broiler' segment, which recorded operating profit of 2 billion rupiah (-93% QoQ) amid a decline in average broiler price to 19,220 rupiah per kg (-5% QoQ). The 'feed' segment, however, posted an increase in operating profit to 145 billion rupiah (+13% QoQ), driven by a rise in average corn price to 4,852 rupiah per kg (+2% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: BREN reports Q1 2025 net profit
tickerNews.content: $BREN: Barito Renewables Energy reported a net profit of 34 million USD in 1Q25 (+19% YoY, -5% QoQ). The YoY profit increase was mainly driven by a reduction in net financial expenses to 26 million USD (-8% YoY, -8% QoQ) after refinancing in September 2024, and a favorable currency exchange gain of 1 million USD (1Q24: loss of 1 million USD, 4Q24: gain of 2 million USD). According to Stockbit, BREN's EBITDA reached 126 million USD in 1Q25 (+3% YoY, -5% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: Fundamental Misconception: UNVR Case Study
tickerNews.content: "Many consider UNVR a business that dominates the essential needs of many people, but forget that the business model can also be disrupted." – Husin1030 (stockbit.com/husin1030)
